question: As Joseph revealed himself to his brothers, he told them that God allowed him to be sold into slavery so as to______________
explanation:
The selling of Joseph was part of God's divine plan for him to save his tribes. He was placed in Egypt so as to preserve lives as a result of preserving food to avert the Famine

Genesis ''Now therefore be not grieved, nor angry with yourselves, that ye sold me hither: for God did send me before you to preserve life''.

question: The parents of Moses did the following to ensure his survival except__________
options: Putting him in a padded basket

question: The Parents of Moses belonged to the tribe of__________
explanation: According to the Torah, the tribe is named after Levi, one of the twelve sons of Jacob (also called Israel). Levi had three sons: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari (Genesis 46:11). Kohath's son Amram was the father of Miriam, Aaron and Moses.

question:

explanation: God declared Joshua, son of Nun, as Moses' successor. Joshua was a man with the spirit of God, a long associate of Moses. Moses was to invest Joshua with some of his authority so that all the congregation of Israel would obey him. Numbers 27:18-20

question: Deborah, a prophetess who was a judge in Israel was the wife of _____________
explanation: According to the Book of Judges, Deborah (Hebrew: דְּבוֹרָה, Devora, "Bee") was a prophetess of the God of the Israelites, the fourth Judge of pre-monarchic Israel and the only female judge mentioned in the Bible, and the wife of Lapidoth.

question: The two sons of Eli were_______________
explanation: There was a man called Eli. He was a priest, and he had two sons, Hophni and Phineas, who were priests also.

question: Why did God Command Saul to entirely destroy Amalek?
explanation: And Samuel said to Saul, “The Lord sent me to anoint you king over his people Israel; now therefore listen to the words of the Lord. question: Prophet Nathan named David Bathsheba's second child________
explanation: The only mention of the name Jedidiah in the Bible is found in 2 Samuel 12:25. King Solomon, second son of David and Bathsheba, was given the name Jedidiah by God. After Solomon was born, God sent a message through the prophet Nathan that his name was to be Jedidiah (Hebrew for “Beloved of the Lord”). Scripture says that God named him Jedidiah “because the Lord loved him” (2 Samuel 12:25). The names Jedidiah and David are related in that the name David means “beloved.”

question: Before the call of James and John. Jesus met them helping their Father to__________

Whoever does not bear his own cross and come after me, cannot be my disciple

This statement means____________
explanation:
To carry one's cross as Jesus said in the book of luke means to deal with your burdens and problems. In the Bible, Jesus carried a cross that has come to be symbolic of the world's problems. Therefore, when people carry their own crosses, they are dealing with their own burdens.

Luke 14:27
options: A Disciple must carry his cross
A Disciple must bear his problems alone
Death on the cross awaits any true Disciple

question:
The response to Peter's question, Lord how often shall my brother sin against me and i forgive him?

Meant that forgiveness is ___________
explanation:
In Matthew 18:21, Jesus said we should forgive 70 X 7 times.

The 70 x 7 expression is symbolic for infinity or limitless; Christians are called to forgive an infinite number of time because that is the number of time they are forgiven by God

Matthew 26

All four Canonical Gospels state that during Jesus' Last Supper with his disciples, he predicted that Peter would deny knowledge of him, stating that Peter would disown him before the rooster crowed the next morning. It was fulfilled just before Jesus was arrested.

After his third denial, when he heard the rooster crow, Peter remembered. "The Lord turned and looked straight at Peter.

explanation: The Seven, often known as the Seven Deacons, were leaders elected by the Early Christian church to minister to the community of believers in Jerusalem, to enable the Apostles to concentrate on 'prayer and the Ministry of the Word'
